[color=white][b]Aprils Fools Filled With Trolls[/b][/color]
First off, Happy April fools from the News Team. It looks like we got a lot of you with the last edition of the news, though, we didn't expect the amount of flame we received towards the Writ3rs, especially the News Team. A lot of people didn't really see it as a joke and started to criticize our work. All jokes aside, we aren't going anywhere; not for a long time at least. We enjoy what we do, and we do it all for fun. We don't get anything in return for publishing our articles in the HF news each and every week.¬†

Official Empire group owner [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=651337][b]Tibit[/b][/url] also pulled an April Fools joke. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=651337][b]Tibit[/b][/url] claimed that they were closing and selling The Empire to former staff member [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=661940][color=#0066FF][b]bugga[/b][/color][/url]. It looks like this was done because a lot of people didn't like how [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=661940][color=#0066FF][b]bugga[/b][/color][/url] moderated the forum, so they thought it would be a great April Fools prank. You may read the official thread located here: [url]http://bit.ly/ZEJaTq[/url].

Official group Graphics Masters also pulled quite an amusing Aprils Fools prank. They posted a wall of graphics that were meant to look terrible. The "Graphics Masters | Show Case can be found here: [url]http://bit.ly/Y3G4sY[/url].¬†

Site owner [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#4DD0FC][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] had also pulled a prank. There was a green notification in the header of Hack Forums which guided people to read their PMs. The PM was allegedly sent out from the Hack Forums server, and took awhile for people to receive as there were so many members to send it to. A lot of people didn't receive it and this still remains a mystery. The official thread posted by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#4DD0FC][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] may be read here: [url]http://bit.ly/10BNrdK[/url].

[color=white][b]All YouTube Awards Granted[/b][/color]
Site owner [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#4DD0FC][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] has announced that all YouTube awards have finally now been granted. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#4DD0FC][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] also said, [i]"If you have not gotten the award please PM me the original data. But I must see the upload date for the video between Dec 28, 2012 and Jan 1, 2013. Otherwise you will be denied the award."[/i]. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#4DD0FC][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] claimed he gave out around 350 YouTube awards which took hours upon hours of work. He doesn't think he will ever do something like this again. It took him about three months to finish all of the awards, but he did it, so we can be thankful he didn't throw it under the rug. If you would like to see the official thread, feel free to do so by clicking here: [url]http://bit.ly/14L0D4h[/url].

[b][color=white]Hack Forums Member #Skyline Makes the Australian News Headlines[/color][/b]
Well known Hack Forums member [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1232842][b]#Skyline[/b][/url] has made it into the Australian News headlines. As most of us know, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1232842][b]#Skyline[/b][/url] spends a lot of time around Remote Administration Tools. A reporter from one of the most popular news sources, The Sydney Morning Herald, asked [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1232842][b]#Skyline[/b][/url] if he would like to be interviewed on Remote Administration Tools, and he agreed to do so. The reporter did an interview over Skype, which to our knowledge was the method of communication. The article is titled [i]"How hackers can switch on your webcam and control your computer".[/i]. You can read the article on "The Sydney Morning Herald" by clicking here: [url]http://bit.ly/XZyPq7[/url].

[color=white][b]New Sponsored Products and Services Forums[/b][/color]
Two more sections have been added under [url=http://hackforums.net/forumdisplay.php?fid=264][b]New Sponsored Products and Services Forums[/b][/url]. These include, [url=http://hackforums.net/forumdisplay.php?fid=270][b]Grim Booter & Grim API[/b][/url] with the forum description: [i]"Grim Products - Providing top notch quality at a fraction of the cost."[/i] This sub-forum is owned and moderated by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1569971][color=#FFD700][b]DeltaDude[/b][/color][/url]. The second sub-forum purchased this month goes by [url=http://hackforums.net/forumdisplay.php?fid=272][b]Cyber-Software[/b][/url] with the forum description: [i]"Cyber-Software products, software that fits your needs."[/i] This is owned and moderated by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=263345][b]Prince of Persia[/b][/url]. For those interested you may purchase your own sub-forum for a current fee of $300 per month. You can read more here: [url]http://bit.ly/YQQe0b[/url].

[color=white][b]HF MRT Pulls a Massive Troll[/b][/color]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=580684][b]RDCA[/b][/url] and [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=128873][b]T3h Hack3r[/b][/url] claimed they have been working with Avast for over a year now, and claimed they have done so undercover and under the spotlight. They also claimed they released information about stressers, and took a lot of products on Hack Forums down with the excuse that these tools were being overly abused by members. They said, [i]"We have targeted several HF products, and released information as to the location of these so called 'stressers'. These are tools which are constantly being abused."[/i] Needless to say, they got a lot of people and claimed they targeted sticky products on the marketplace. Unfortunately it being April 1st, a lot of people had a feeling that was a troll. Good effort [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=580684][b]RDCA[/b][/url] and [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=128873][b]T3h Hack3r[/b][/url]. You may read the official thread here: [url]http://bit.ly/ZETmv2[/url].

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711]D3xus[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=190854][color=#FFA500][b]CarrotMilk:[/b][/color][/url] Today, for the 137th edition of the Hack Forums news, we are joined by the one and only [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711]D3xus[/url]! Hey bud! Before we begin, would you like to make any shoutouts?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b]D3xus:[/b][/color][/url] I'm honored to be interviewed; I did it for so long. Shoutouts... All members of InFaMoUs, The Alliance, Red Lions and the Writers. Ethereal for being my compatriot with the Wiki. xadamxk for being a badass in training. Mr. Snow for being one of the few sensible people who exercises his freedom of speech. 

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=190854][color=#FFA500][b]CarrotMilk:[/b][/color][/url] Sorry, I don't think I can continue the interview with someone who shouts out xadamxk D:
Just kidding!
How are you doing today, D3xus? 
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b] D3xus:[/b][/color][/url] Doing good. Setting up my Raspberry Pi computer for coding and Linux. My dad got it for me for about $20 and it's amazing.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=190854][color=#FFA500][b]CarrotMilk:[/b][/color][/url] Raspberry Pis are so awesome for the price. Coding, eh? What language are you looking to code in? And what Linux distro are you using? Coming from a macphag here, going back to a non-unix OS would just be weird :P
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b] D3xus:[/b][/color][/url] I'm using Raspbian. I'm learning to code in C++ and Java so I can take the AP Computer Science exam... it would look great on a college resume.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=190854][color=#FFA500][b]CarrotMilk:[/b][/color][/url] Ooh, so you're in high school right now? You'll have to forgive me, I'm not overly familiar with the American education system üòù Are you looking to do Comp sci in college?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b] D3xus:[/b][/color][/url] I'm hoping to pursue a degree in Computer Science, yeah. There are a lot of career opportunities and it is one of the fastest growing industries. 

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=190854][color=#FFA500][b]CarrotMilk:[/b][/color][/url] I completely agree. 
What do you think it is about technology that captivates people so much?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b] D3xus:[/b][/color][/url] People love how it can do so many things in a small amount of space or computer power. People are mesmerized by it.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=190854][color=#FFA500][b]CarrotMilk:[/b][/color][/url] Are you at all afraid about this potential that's still being unlocked? I mean, could technology take us [i]too[/i] far?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b] D3xus:[/b][/color][/url] I'm sure some [s]genius[/s] idiot will do something to fuck humanity up. Just a hunch.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=190854][color=#FFA500][b]CarrotMilk:[/b][/color][/url] Well, that's just inevitable, I suppose üòù Is there any upcoming technology that you're excited about?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b] D3xus:[/b][/color][/url]  I suppose I am looking forward to when humanity builds self constructive robots. They can build and program themselves and outnumber humans in a short amount of time. It's scary but I'm curious to see what will happen. 

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=190854][color=#FFA500][b]CarrotMilk:[/b][/color][/url] Haha, exactly. So, what was it that first brought you to HF? :)
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b] D3xus:[/b][/color][/url] For the longest time, I'd googled extremely naive, but at the time awesome, things for hacking or gaming things. How to hack websites. Boot people off of Xbox Live. Make lots of money. The simple things. I kept coming to HF, but I couldn't view any threads because of the guest permissions. I procrastinated joining, but one day gave up and decided to join. I then lost sight of why I came and stuck around the iDevice forum for god knows how long.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=190854][color=#FFA500][b]CarrotMilk:[/b][/color][/url] Hmm. I don't think I should ask you this, but [b]why[/b] iOS over Android? üòù
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b] D3xus:[/b][/color][/url] At the moment it's a tie. Android is much more user friendly and has a lot of different things that iOS doesn't have; Apple just seems to copy everything from jailbreak tweak developers and other companies and then cry about it whenever someone else steals their stuff.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=190854][color=#FFA500][b]CarrotMilk:[/b][/color][/url] Haha! I personally think that, although iOS is a great OS, there's nothing that makes it special. In my mind, at least. I think it needs to be freshened up a bit üòù
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b] D3xus:[/b][/color][/url] There are some good and bad things about iOS. Overall, it's a tie. They both have great features and things to compete with one another so they kinda even out in the end.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=190854][color=#FFA500][b]CarrotMilk:[/b][/color][/url] Thank you, good sir <3 Any last words before we go our separate ways?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b] D3xus:[/b][/color][/url] Never look back unless you plan on going that way.
[/spoiler]

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=751152]Vazity[/url][/font][/size]
[spoiler=]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1050193][color=#91FF00][b]Connected:[/b][/color][/url] Welcome to your first interview, Vazity! Shall we start with your shout outs?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=751152][color=white][b]Vazity:[/b][/color][/url] Yes! I want to throw a shoutout for my friends Froggy, Insidious and Razmus! I hope they've been enjoying their week on HF! üôÇ

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1050193][color=#91FF00][b]Connected:[/b][/color][/url] How did you find HF in the first place? Did you expect it to be as important to you as it is today?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=751152][color=white][b]Vazity:[/b][/color][/url] I originally visited Hack Forums, for the first time in 2008. Decided not to register though. It was after my friend hacked some Habbo Packets, so he could duplicate the russian samovar and dragon eggs (purple, green eggy things). That's how I found it. Didn't really expect HF to be that important to me. Later on I joined a danish hacking forum, figuring out that they where all on HF too, decided to finally register and I haven't regretted it since. I love it!

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1050193][color=#91FF00][b]Connected:[/b][/color][/url] Have you learned anything while browsing the forums? If yes, what exactly?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=751152][color=white][b]Vazity:[/b][/color][/url] I've learnt a lot about the subject hacking to be honest, and about malware removal. HF is one of the best resources on the web I think to be honest, there's so much to be learnt. Since I joined HF, I've been become a lot more knowledgeable on hacking, and the different types of malware and such. Also expanded my webprogramming knowledge and actually learnt a few other languages from HF.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1050193][color=#91FF00][b]Connected:[/b][/color][/url] What do you think about HF as a community?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=751152][color=white][b]Vazity:[/b][/color][/url] It's a great community, though there are a few bad people here and there, but overall I think it's good!

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1050193][color=#91FF00][b]Connected:[/b][/color][/url] I see you're hosting a big giveaway thread. What inspired you to make it?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=751152][color=white][b]Vazity:[/b][/color][/url]  I was in such a good mood, decided to throw a big donation, and decided to celebrate my birthday in a way also being nice to other people, to be honest I am really happy these days so I thought I would give back the favor and make people in a good mood too!

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1050193][color=#91FF00][b]Connected:[/b][/color][/url] I also see that you're a member of the Red Lions. Do you aim to be in any other groups?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=751152][color=white][b]Vazity:[/b][/color][/url] Well I have been looking out for The Empire too, many of my friends are a part of it and told me it's amazing, that's the only one for the moment. üôÇ Though I also feel fine being a part of RL as the only group.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1050193][color=#91FF00][b]Connected:[/b][/color][/url] That's damn right! The Empire is amazing! üôÇ Do you generate income IRL or online?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=751152][color=white][b]Vazity:[/b][/color][/url] Actually it's not going to be kept a secret. I make every single penny online. I am generating all my income online and have been doing so for a long time. I make it from my website called ViewTube and my 2 pieces of software called YouFlagger and YouComment and I am having great success with it as of the moment.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1050193][color=#91FF00][b]Connected:[/b][/color][/url] Very nice! That's some well-deserved income. Do you have any hobbies?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=751152][color=white][b]Vazity:[/b][/color][/url] Well I do not really have any in-real-life hobbies for the moment, I run and workout a few times a week together with some friends, and go out having some enjoyable time with friends. Though I have thought about doing starting for some sports in some weeks / months.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1050193][color=#91FF00][b]Connected:[/b][/color][/url] Thanks for letting me interview you buddy! I wish you best of luck with everything and happy birthday in advance! Do you have any final words?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=751152][color=white][b]Vazity:[/b][/color][/url] Thank you Connected. I just wanna say it's fantastic to be apart of such a community, and thank you for interviewing me it's been fun! See everybody around on the forums! üôÇ
[/spoiler]

[b][color=white]Minecraft 2.0[/color][/b]
Last week Mojang announced a major release titled [i]Minecraft 2.0[/i], a "2-years-in-development game which would revolutionize blocky simulators." This announcement was, of course, made on April Fool's day however the joke was [i]very[/i] well played out; Mojang asked select youtubers, such as each member of the [url=http://www.mindcracknetwork.com/]Mindcrack[/url] network, to release a video showing [i]Minecraft 2.0[/i] in action. [color=white][b]New Xbox "always-online" Sources + Twitter Drama [/b][/color]
New source reports and disappointing Twitter drama you must read. Microsoft's upcoming Xbox is back in the spotlight with fresh "always-online" drama. Sources claim that the next-generation console will require an internet connection to boot-up. A source contacted Kotaku explaining that if the connection goes offline for more than three minutes, any game or application will be suspended, which means you may be greeted with the Xbox dashboard. "Unless something has changed recently, Durango consumer units must have an active internet connection to be used," the source said. After this information shed light, Microsoft Studios creative director Adam Orth argued against the drama with "always-on" internet connection. Adam on his personal Twitter account account (which was recently set to private after the drama), argued "sorry, I don't get the drama around having an 'always on' console. Every device now is 'always on'. That's the world we live in. #dealwithit". "Did you learn nothing from Diablo III or SimCity? You know some people's internet goes out right? Deal with it is a sh***y reason," replied BioWare gameplay designer Manveer Heir. "Electricity goes out too," said Orth in response. "The mobile reception in the area I live in is spotty and unreliable. I will not buy a mobile phone," Orth said as a joke. What is going to happen now? No one knows, however the next-generation Xbox should be announced within the next two months, where the "always-online" situation will finally be dealt with.

[color=white][b]Mortal Kombat Komplete Edition Hitting Australia[/b][/color]
Australia was recently granted the R18+ rating in January, meaning games could have been re-rated to be launched in Australia. [color=white][b]Italy Promises to Pay Debt[/b][/color]
The Italian government has announced that it would repay 52 billion dollars to private firms. The payments are going to take place over the span of a year. Italy's Prime Minister, Mario Monti, said that the debt was "an unacceptable situation that has been accepted for a long time." The decree has been somewhat concerning for the European Union, but the Prime Minister eased worries by saying, "Economic policy is not changing course, and we don't believe that to revive the economy you have to create more public debt," The Italian government has eased their target debt-to-GDP ratio from 1.8 to 2.9. The Economy Minister explained, "We have to follow a path between the two requirements: to help our economy to recover ... and to maintain budget discipline."

[color=white][b]Kansas Enacting Pro-life Bill[/b][/color]
On Friday night, both the Kansas strongly republican House of Representatives and Senate house passed a bill that strongly restricts abortion rights. The bill defines the beginning of life at conception. It sets a lot more restrictions such as banning abortions on basis of the fetus' gender and not allowing employees of abortion clinics to give sex education. In the event that the bill is actually enacted, it will be only the 8th state to define life as beginning at conception. Elizabeth Nash, state issues manager of the pro-choice Guttmacher Institute "It's a statement of intent and it's a pretty strong statement...should the U.S. Supreme Court overturn Roe v. Wade or should the court come to some different conclusion, the state legislature would be ready, willing and able to ban abortions."

[b][color=white]Five Egyptians Die After Religious Clash[/color][/b]
In a city near Cairo, a fight between Christians and Muslims left 5 people died and 8 injured. Out of the 5 deaths, 1 of them has been identified a Muslim, and the 4 others were identified as Christian Copts. In the incident, Christian businesses were vandalized, a Christian daycare was set ablaze, and a Muslim's apartment was burned down. The catalyst of the event seems to be Chistian children writing religious text on a Muslim institute wall. Mahmoud Mahmoud al-Alfi, a Muslim, said, "I saw the kids drawing on the wall after afternoon prayers so I grabbed them and told them to remove what they'd just written." The situation turned hotter when another person came onto the scene and started assaulted the children. After that, another man shot one of the boys--killing them.
